avalancheActivity.comment:
Above approximately 1200 m snow will fall until the afternoon. Over a wide area over a wide area 20 to 25 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2000 m. The wind was moderate in the vicinity of peaks.
The more recent wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. They are to be found especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls in all aspects.
In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation and at intermediate and high altitudes the avalanche danger will increase rapidly to level 3 (considerable).
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs: At intermediate and high altitudes a considerable avalanche danger will prevail.

snowpackStructure.comment: Wind and new snow above approximately 1200 m. 20 cm of snow fell on Thursday above approximately 2000 m. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow significantly. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. The old snowpack will be generally stable.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Above approximately 1500 m snow will fall until the afternoon. In these regions the avalanche danger will increase gradually to level 2 (moderate).
The fresh snow of the last two days and in particular the mostly small wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant, in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation caution is to be exercised in particular on steep slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The new snow and wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
Large-grained weak layers exist in the snowpack in particular on shady slopes. This applies especially on shady slopes. The old snowpack remains generally stable.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Above approximately 1500 m snow will fall until the afternoon.
The fresh snow of the last two days and in particular the mostly small wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation this applies in particular on very steep slopes.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation above approximately 2100 m danger level 2 (moderate) will be reached.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The new snow will be deposited on bare ground over a wide area.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. This applies in particular on shady slopes and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
The old snowpack remains generally stable.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In particular along the border with France some new snow to intermediate altitudes. The mostly small wind slabs can be released in some cases in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2300 m. This applies in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The new snow will be deposited on bare ground over a wide area. This applies in particular on sunny slopes, as well as at low and intermediate altitudes.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
The old snowpack remains generally stable.
